text: {{Infobox settlement |name=Federally Administered Tribal Areas |native_name= () |native_name_lang= |settlement_type= |image_skyline= 2007 08 27 Pakistan Khyber Gate on Jamrud Road looking west bound IMG 9936.jpg |imagesize= |image_alt= |image_caption= Bab-e-Khyber |image_flag=Flag of FATA.svg |flag_alt=Flag of FATA |image_seal= Coat of arms of FATA.svg |seal_alt= Coat of arms of FATA |image_shield= |shield_alt= |nickname= |motto= |image_map=Federally Administered Tribal Areas in Pakistan (claims hatched).svg |map_alt= |map_caption=Location of the Federally Administered Tribal Areas |image_dot_map= |dot_mapsize= |dot_map_base_alt= |dot_map_alt= |dot_map_caption= |dot_x=|dot_y= |pushpin_map= |pushpin_label_position= |pushpin_map_alt= |pushpin_map_caption= |coordinates = |coordinates_footnotes= |subdivision_type=Country |subdivision_name= |subdivision_type1=Administrative unit |subdivision_name1=Federal territory |subdivision_type2=Components |subdivision_name2=7 Agencies 6 Frontier Regions |subdivision_type3= |subdivision_name3= |established_title= |established_date=1st July 1970 |founder= |named_for= |seat_type=Administrative centre |seat=Peshawar |government_footnotes= |leader_party= |leader_title=Governor of Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa |leader_name=Syed Masood Kausar |leader_title1= |leader_name1= |total_type= |unit_pref= |area_magnitude= |area_footnotes= |area_total_km2=27220 |area_land_km2= |area_water_km2= |area_water_percent= |area_note= |elevation_footnotes= |elevation_m= |population_footnotes= |population_total=3176331 |population_as_of=1998 |population_density_km2=auto |population_est= |pop_est_as_of= |population_demonym= |population_note= |utc_offset1=+5 |timezone1_DST= |utc_offset1_DST= |postal_code_type= |postal_code= |area_code_type= |area_code= |website=http://www.fata.gov.pk/ |footnotes= }} The Federally Administered Tribal Areas (FATA) () in Pakistan were areas of Pakistan outside the four provinces, comprising a region of some 27,220 km² (10,507 mi²). The FATA were merged with the province of Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa in 2017. Miran Shah was the tribal capital. There are seven areas known as Agencies and six areas known as Frontier Regions. *Bajaur Agency *Khyber Agency *Kurram Agency *Mohmand Agency *Orakzai Agency *North Waziristan Agency *South Waziristan Agency == Frontier Regions == The Frontier Regions are named after their adjacent settled districts. The administration of the FR is carried out by the DCO / DC of the neighbouring named district. The overall administration of the frontier regions is carried out by the FATA Secretariat, based in Peshawar and reporting to the Governor of Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa. The six regions are: *Frontier Region Bannu *Frontier Region Dera Ismail Khan *Frontier Region Kohat *Frontier Region Lakki Marwat *Frontier Region Peshawar *Frontier Region Tank (Jandola) == Geography == The FATA are bordered by: Afghanistan to the west with the border marked by the Durand Line, Khyber- Pakhtunkhwa to the north and east, and Balochistan to the south. The seven Tribal Areas lie in a north-to-south strip that is adjacent to the west side of the six Frontier Regions, which also lie in a north-to-south strip. The areas within each of those two regions are geographically arranged in a sequence from north to south. The geographical arrangement of the seven Tribal Areas in order from north to south is: Bajaur Agency, Mohmand Agency, Khyber, Orakzai Agency, Kurram, North Waziristan, South Waziristan. The geographical arrangement of the six Frontier Regions in order from north to south is: Peshawar, Kohat, Bannu, Lakki Marwat, Tank, Dera Ismail Khan. == References == Category:Federally Administered Tribal Areas Category:Territories of Pakistan
